caption:
This photograph depicts a suburban setting likely from the 1970s or early 1980s, based on the style of the architecture and vehicles. In the foreground, we see several two-story houses with wooden shingles on their roofs and dark brown sidings. The structures are built on a sloping residential street.

Prominently featured in the scene is a classic gold-colored car, possibly a sedan from the 1970s, parked curbside. Alongside the car, on the street, we see four children walking together. They appear to be engaged in conversation or perhaps enjoying a leisurely stroll.

The background reveals a more urban landscape with taller multi-story buildings that suggest either a business district or apartment complexes. The skyline is somewhat hazy, indicating either fog or smog.

Overall, the scene paints a vivid picture of suburban life during this era, juxtaposed with the urban development seen in the distance, and captures a moment of daily activity and childhood in this neighborhood.
title: Part of the intensive residential development underway around the harbor at coastal development has come under increasing restrictions since the implementation of the coastal zone conservation act in 1973.  The commissions regulating the act must submit a report to the state legislature recommending laws which will affect coastal development throughout the state
